items.title: T-Mobile is raising prices on some of its prized legacy plans
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- T-Mobile will increase prices by $5 per line for some legacy plan customers starting April 2nd, 2025.
- Affected customers were notified via text messages about the price increase.
- The increase is part of adjustments addressing 'rising costs'; specific legacy plans affected are currently unclear, but newer plans like Go5G are not included.
- T-Mobile assures that most customers will not be affected and maintains its commitment to low prices and value across all plans.

items.title: Apple’s AirPods 4 are down to their lowest price to date
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- Apple’s AirPods 4 are discounted to $99.99 at major retailers, a 22% reduction from the original price of $129.
- They feature spatial audio with dynamic head tracking and an open design for comfort.
- An upgraded model with Active Noise Cancellation is available for $148.99, offering additional features like Adaptive Audio and wireless charging.

items.title: Here are the best robot vacuum deals right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Roborock's S8 MaxV Ultra is discounted to $1,099 ($700 off) with efficient vacuuming and mopping.
- The Roborock S8 Pro Ultra is available for $899.99 ($700 off) but lacks some features of the MaxV.
- The Roborock S8 Plus is on sale for $549.99 ($450 off) and offers good scrubbing with 6,000Pa suction.
- The Roborock Q5 Pro is reduced to $179.99 ($250 off), noted for handling pet hair effectively.
- The Dreame X40 Ultra is $999.99 ($500 off) with advanced self-cleaning and AI navigation features.
- The Dreame L20 Ultra is priced at $599.99 ($400 off) and includes a base station for cleaning processes.
- The SwitchBot S10 is now $499.99 ($700 off), a cost-effective robot that refills and dries its mop pads.

items.title: Apple is reportedly bringing live translation to AirPods
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple plans to introduce live translation for AirPods with the upcoming iOS 19.
- The feature enables real-time conversation translation, such as from Spanish to English.
- Apple is reportedly behind competitors like Google, which launched live translation on its Pixel Buds in 2017.

items.title: A24’s Opus is a stylish symphony of half-baked ideas
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- A24’s *Opus*, a horror-tinged thriller directed by Mark Anthony Green, explores the relationship between entertainment journalists and celebrities.
- The protagonist, Ariel Ecton, struggles with a self-involved editor while navigating the music journalism landscape.
- Featuring John Malkovich as the reclusive star Alfred Moretti, the film includes original songs and a stylish visual presentation.
- *Opus* starts strong but loses mystery as the plot unfolds with predictable twists and unimpressive character dynamics.
- Set for theatrical release on March 14th, the film's strong soundtrack and Malkovich's performance may still engage viewers despite its flaws.

items.title: Google is rolling out a fix for broken Chromecasts
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Google is addressing 'untrusted device' errors affecting Chromecast devices.
- Errors impacted mainly Chromecast 2nd generation and Chromecast Audio models, reportedly due to an expired certificate.
- A fix is being rolled out and will complete within days; devices must be connected to receive it.
- Users facing setup issues after a factory reset are advised to check updates on Google's support post or follow shared user solutions on Reddit.

items.title: The Best Budget Smartphones of 2023
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Budget smartphones are now more capable, typically priced around $500 or less.
- Important factors to consider: OS upgrades, screen quality (preferably OLED), and adequate storage (minimum 64GB).
- Compromises may include slower processors, lower resolution screens, and fewer camera features compared to flagship models.
- Notable models discussed include:
  - Apple iPhone 16E: Cheapest new iPhone with a 48-megapixel camera and starting price of $599.
  - Google Pixel 8A: Offers seven years of software support, starting at $399, with a solid camera and 120Hz display.
  - OnePlus 12R: High-end feel with a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor and 120Hz OLED screen for $500.

items.title: AI Summaries Are Coming to Notepad
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Microsoft is testing AI-powered summaries in Notepad for Windows Insiders.
- Users can summarize text by highlighting, right-clicking, and selecting 'Summarize', or using the 'Ctrl + M' shortcut.
- New features include the ability to view recently closed files and a 'draw & hold' function in the Snipping Tool.

items.title: Tesla Cybertruck deliveries reportedly on hold because the trim is flying off
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Deliveries of the Tesla Cybertruck are currently on hold due to issues with the vehicle's trim detaching.
- Customers have been informed of a "containment hold" by Tesla service representatives, although specific details about the trim issues are not mentioned.
- The hold may last several weeks and is a preventative measure linked to a reported problem with the cantrail trim over the truck’s doors.
- Previous complaints cited trim above windows as being poorly attached, raising quality concerns.
- Tesla has previously issued a recall for over 11,000 trucks due to trim adhesion problems, indicating ongoing issues with Cybertruck quality.

items.title: The hunt for the next Twitter: all the news about alternative social media platforms
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elon Musk took over Twitter (now called X) over two years ago, leading to the rise of alternative platforms like Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
- Threads reached 275 million monthly users by October 2024 and is focusing on integration with the fediverse utilizing ActivityPub protocol.
- Bluesky, despite its growth, has 14.5 million users, less than Threads, and has seen a surge post-2024 elections.
- Mastodon continues to exist but struggles for growth compared to the others.
- No clear successor to Twitter has emerged, though X remains dominant for many users and businesses.
- New features from Bluesky include moderation updates, new video capabilities, and apps like Flashes for enhanced media posting.

items.title: WinRing0: Why Windows is flagging your PC monitoring and fan control apps as a threat
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Windows Defender flagged a tool called WinRing0 as a HackTool, affecting many PC monitoring and fan control applications.
- The detection led to various software misbehaving, such as fans running excessively.
- Programs affected include Fan Control, Razer Synapse, and MSI Afterburner, all of which used WinRing0 for hardware monitoring.
- Developers express concern as WinRing0 poses a real vulnerability that could be exploited, although its current use in these applications is not malicious.
- Microsoft has been pressured to tighten security around kernel-level drivers after previous incidents and may not have communicated the changes clearly.
- Developers have explored alternatives but face challenges due to high costs associated with getting drivers signed by Microsoft, restricting open-source projects.
- Some companies are finding ways to address this issue, hoping to create a signed version of WinRing0 to help affected applications.

items.title: The best Garmin watches for training and everyday life
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Garmin watches are popular among various athletes and outdoor enthusiasts, known for fitness tracking and rugged durability.
- Recent Garmin models cater to both athletes and general users, emphasizing fitness metrics, GPS navigation, and long battery life.
- Notably, Garmin watches have features such as offline maps, advanced training metrics, and safety capabilities like fall detection.
- The Forerunner 265/265S offers a balance of price and features, including an OLED display and long battery life, priced at about $450.
- The Epix Pro provides extensive fitness features, available in multiple sizes, combining the best of Garmin's offerings starting at $720.

items.title: The Olympics will stay on NBC for at least another decade
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- NBC has extended its media rights deal with the International Olympic Committee (IOC) to air the Olympics until 2036.
- The previous agreement allowed NBC to stream the Olympics through 2032; the new deal is valued at $3 billion for the 2033 to 2036 cycle.
- Last year's Olympics led to a 33% increase in viewers on Peacock, indicating the importance of the event for NBC's streaming platform.

items.title: Flatiron Books says it will keep publishing book from ex-Meta employee
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Flatiron Books will continue to publish the book "Careless People" by ex-Meta staffer Sarah Wynn-Williams despite a recent arbitration order.
- The arbitration ruling instructed the author to stop making "disparaging" remarks against Meta and cease promoting the book.
- Macmillan, Flatiron's parent company, condemned Meta's tactics to silence the author and affirmed their commitment to the book after thorough editing and vetting.

items.title: Mercedes-Benz is hedging its bets with rebooted CLA sedan
items.author: Abigail Bassett
items.summary:
- Mercedes-Benz’s electric vehicles have underperformed, prompting a reevaluation of their electrification strategy.
- CEO Ola Källenius announced the introduction of the MMA platform, which will support internal combustion, hybrid, and electric vehicles.
- The CLA sedan will debut as an EV first, primarily focusing on enhancing passenger space and comfort.
- The vehicle will feature two battery options, with the U.S. getting a larger 85.5 kWh battery, targeting a range of approximately 350 miles.
- It will incorporate advanced braking technology and 800-volt architecture for ultra-fast charging capabilities.
- The CLA includes a new software stack, MB.OS, that offers an AI-enhanced user experience and the potential for semi-autonomous driving features.
- The electric CLA is set to launch first in China and Europe, with U.S. availability planned for the fall, although pricing details remain unconfirmed.

items.title: Android 16 is getting a major hearing accessibility feature
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Android will soon support Auracast, enhancing audio broadcasts for Bluetooth LE hearing aids.
- This feature will allow users to connect directly to audio streams in challenging listening environments like airports and concerts.
- Samsung Galaxy and Pixel 9 devices will support Auracast with an Android 16 beta update, allowing users to scan QR codes for connections.
- Google announced Android 16 has reached platform stability, nearing full launch, with a focus on I/O developments.

items.title: Here are the best iPad deals right now
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Current iPad deals are available beyond major sales events like Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day.
- Discounts include the latest models such as the iPad Pro, iPad Mini, and iPad Air.
- For the 10th-gen iPad (2022), prices start at $269, with the 256GB variant at $395.
- The 11th-gen iPad (2025) starts at $329, offering upgraded storage and speed.
- The seventh-gen iPad Mini is priced at $479, featuring a new A17 Pro chip.
- Pricing for the iPad Air starts at $499, with discounts available on various configurations.

items.title: Black Mirror dreams a little dream in season 7 trailer
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The trailer for season 7 of *Black Mirror* features themes like AI, virtual worlds, and video games, all with a dark twist.
- Season 7 will have six episodes, including a sequel to “USS Callister,” with two episodes being feature-length.
- The cast includes well-known names like Paul Giamatti, Issa Rae, and Will Poulter, but details about the episodes remain secret.
- New episodes will premiere on April 10th, 2024, coinciding with other notable series releases in April.

items.title: Tesla’s Next-Gen Vehicle: Everything You Need to Know About Elon Musk’s Affordable EV
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elon Musk has promised an affordable electric vehicle priced around $25,000 to make EVs more accessible.
- This concept was first introduced in a 2018 interview and discussed further during Tesla's 2020 Battery Day event.
- Tesla's 'Unboxed Process' manufacturing breakthrough aims to reduce costs and support high-volume production of these vehicles.
- The planned next-gen vehicle may be a crossover or hatchback, possibly featuring design elements from the Cybertruck.
- There are speculations that Tesla may simply offer stripped-down versions of Model Ys as more affordable options.

items.title: The Trump administration faces a fight over ‘biggest’ environmental deregulatory action in US history
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The Trump administration launched a significant deregulation initiative affecting numerous environmental regulations in the US.
- EPA administrator Lee Zeldin stated this was 'the greatest day of deregulation our nation has seen,' proposing 31 actions to roll back major pollution controls.
- Advocacy groups are prepared to challenge these changes legally, emphasizing the need for extensive rulemaking processes to follow due protocol.
- The EPA aims to reconsider various regulations, including those on mercury, toxic air pollutants, and greenhouse gases.
- Environmental advocates warn that the proposed rollbacks could lead to negative health impacts, despite the administration claiming they would make cars and businesses more affordable.
- The changes are accompanied by significant staffing reductions at the EPA, complicating the implementation of new rules.

items.title: PowerWash Simulator 2 will let you blast away grime in split screen co-op
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- PowerWash Simulator 2 set for release later this year.
- New campaign with additional locations and jobs expands the gameplay.
- Introduces a customizable home base and split-screen co-op mode.
- Original PowerWash Simulator launched in 2022; gained popularity with various crossover packs.

items.title: Lexus’ sporty RZ is the latest EV with fake engine noises to simulate gear-shifting
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Lexus is updating its RZ electric vehicle lineup with a simulated manual gearbox and a steer-by-wire system.
- The RZ 550e F Sport features an 'Interactive Manual Drive' system that creates the feeling of gear shifts through sound and acceleration synchronization.
- The revamped RZ offers a range of approximately 357 miles (based on the WLTP system) owing to an upgraded 77 kWh battery, up from 71.5 kWh.

items.title: Sony’s new RGB backlight tech absolute smokes regular Mini LED TVs
items.author: Sam Byford
items.summary:
- Sony announces a new RGB LED backlighting technology for TVs, potentially superior to current Mini LED displays.
- The new backlighting uses individual red, green, and blue LEDs, allowing finer control over color and maintaining high brightness of 4000 cd/m².
- Improved viewing angles and color reproduction compared to traditional Mini LED TVs, with a prototype outperforming the flagship Bravia 9 in tests.
- Sony's RGB LED technology could bridge the gap between OLED and Mini LED, appealing to consumers needing larger, brighter displays.

items.title: Gemini can now personalize its answers based on your search history
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Gemini can now use user search history to personalize responses, powered by the Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking Experimental model.
- The feature references search history only if it enhances the response, useful for inquiries like restaurant or travel recommendations.
- Users can opt out of using their search history and will see how responses are generated, including references to their prior data.
- The feature is part of a broader rollout of personalization features across Google and associated apps.
- Gemini subscribers can enable this feature through the web and it is gradually available on mobile in over 40 languages.

items.title: Fortnite is coming to Windows on Arm
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Fortnite will launch on Windows devices utilizing Qualcomm’s Arm-based Snapdragon chips later this year.
- Epic Games is collaborating with Qualcomm to implement Windows on Snapdragon support for Easy Anti-Cheat.
- This compatibility will help Fortnite and other games addressing the unique challenges of the Snapdragon architecture, as current PC games are mainly tailored for x64 systems.

items.title: Get Four Months of Disney Plus and Hulu for Just $12
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Current promotion offers Disney Plus and Hulu Bundle Basic plan for $2.99 per month for the first four months until March 30th.
- Normally priced at $10.99 per month, this deal saves subscribers around $32.
- Offer is available for new and qualifying returning subscribers to Disney Plus, Hulu, and/or ESPN Plus.
- The ad-supported Basic plan includes access to a vast library of content from both services, including shows like *Andor* and *Daredevil*.
- After the promotional period, the subscription will renew at the standard rate of $10.99 per month.

items.title: Google is bringing a lot more Android games to PCs
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Google will make all mobile Android games available on Google Play Games on PC by default unless developers opt out.
- The service, launched in beta in 2022, is expanding its game offerings and adding a 'playability badge' to indicate quality and performance.
- Google is investing in bringing more PC games to the platform and will open its native PC program to all developers later this year.
- A full catalog of games will be accessible on AMD laptops and desktops, with plans to integrate it into new PC devices' start menus.

items.title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Major advancements in AI technology are changing the internet landscape, focusing on models like ChatGPT and Gemini.
- Google is racing to build advanced AI tools, highlighting the introduction of Gemini, which incorporates new capabilities including multimodal processing.
- Concerns over AI hallucination affecting content reliability are gaining attention amongst developers and users.
- Companies are integrating AI tools for various applications, raising discussions on implications for creative fields and accuracy in generated content.
- AI in journalism is evolving, with publications like the LA Times incorporating AI-generated insights and bias analysis in articles.
- AI chatbots are becoming commonplace in workplaces, with surveys showing mixed feelings about their impact on jobs and productivity.

items.title: Microsoft’s new Xbox Copilot will act as an AI gaming coach
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft announces the upcoming launch of **Copilot for Gaming**, an AI assistant for Xbox players.
- Initially available through the Xbox mobile app, it will guide players and assist with game downloads.
- During a demo, Copilot provided coaching for **Overwatch 2**, analyzing player mistakes and suggesting hero picks.
- It can also answer crafting-related questions in **Minecraft** and help locate materials.
- Early testing will start with Xbox Insiders in April, with a broader release planned later.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The FTC clarified it has enough staff to proceed with its case against Amazon despite earlier claims of needing a delay.
- The lawsuit involves accusations that Amazon misled consumers regarding its Prime subscription practices.
- A federal judge is reviewing plans of the Trump administration's actions towards the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB).

items.title: The FTC has enough staff to pursue its case against Amazon after all
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- The FTC clarifies that it has sufficient staffing to pursue its case against Amazon, contradicting an earlier statement requesting a trial delay due to staff losses.
- An FTC attorney, Jonathan Cohen, initially sought a two-month delay in the trial set for September 22nd, citing resource constraints but later retracted this statement.
- The case involves allegations of deceptive practices by Amazon regarding its Prime sign-up and cancellation process.

items.title: Warner Bros. is turning All You Need Is Kill into a stunning new anime movie
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Japan announced development of a new anime movie based on the novel *All You Need Is Kill* by Hiroshi Sakurazaka.
- Directed by Kenichiro Akimoto, known for *Children of the Sea* and *Harmony*.
- The story focuses on soldiers Keiji Kiriya and Rita Vrataski trapped in a time loop during an alien invasion, shifting the narrative perspective to Rita.
- A trailer suggests a visually stunning film, though no casting or release date has been revealed.

items.title: Sigma BF review: the perfect camera for a minimalist
items.author: Vjeran Pavic
items.summary:
- Sigma’s BF camera priced at $2,000 lacks many conventional features like a viewfinder, hot shoe, and in-body stabilization.
- The camera has a minimalist design, made from a single block of aluminum, which enhances ease of use despite some ergonomic challenges.
- Features a simple control interface with one dial for quick access to settings; includes 13 film simulations that enhance photo creativity.
- Offers a bright 3.2-inch screen for reviewing photos and has 230GB of internal storage without expandable options, requiring careful management of space.
- Excellent photo quality with impressive low-light performance, though video capabilities are secondary with limitations like no stabilization and a small battery life.
- Suitable primarily for enthusiasts looking for a fun and modern photography experience rather than a versatile hybrid camera.

items.title: Why Trump can’t be trusted with Congress’ new anti-deepfake bill
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- The Take It Down Act aims to criminalize the distribution of non-consensual imagery, including AI-generated content.
- Sponsored by Sen. Amy Klobuchar and Sen. Ted Cruz, the bill just passed the Senate, mandating platforms to remove NCII within 48 hours or face penalties.
- Concerns arise over the potential misuse of the law by the Trump administration against perceived enemies, with fears it could undermine free speech.

items.title: All the smart home news, reviews, and gadgets you need to know about
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The smart home technology offers convenience, safety, and energy efficiency.
- However, it can also be complicated and challenging to keep up with new products and features.
- A guide will be provided for staying updated on developments from major companies like Apple, Amazon, and Google.
- New technologies such as Matter, Thread, and UWB are being covered.
- Home Assistant's certification process is lengthy, but it supports most Matter devices.
- iRobot has launched new Roombas featuring lidar mapping technology.
- Ikea is set to release a Matter-over-Thread temperature sensor called Timmerflotte.
- Eve is launching a Matter over Thread dimmer switch for $49.95, expected in March.

items.title: Facebook, Instagram, and Threads start testing Community Notes next week
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Meta begins testing Community Notes on Facebook, Instagram, and Threads starting **March 18th** in the US.
- Approximately **200,000 contributors** have signed up for the waitlist; not all will be able to participate at launch.
- Notes must be **500 characters or less** and require a supportive link; names of authors will not be public initially.
- Community Notes will build on X's model, requiring agreement from contributors with diverse viewpoints before publication.
- Aimed at countering biases perceived in **traditional fact-checking**, Community Notes will be accessible in several languages including English and Spanish.
- Meta will continue utilizing a third-party fact-checking system outside the US, with plans for global expansion of the feature in the future.

items.title: The latest alternative iOS app store in Europe is all about games
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- A new third-party app store, Skich, is launching for iPhone users in the EU, focusing on mobile gamers.
- The store is available via [its official website](https://skich.app/) and promises a personalized game discovery experience.
- No games will be available at launch; games are expected to start appearing in March.
- Developers will be charged a 15% fee on purchases, lower than Apple's 20% fee.
- Skich is notable despite launching without titles due to the limited third-party app stores post-EU Digital Markets Act.

items.title: All the news about Nvidia’s RTX 50-series GPUs
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Ti review indicates it's a cheaper alternative to the RTX 4080.
- Concerns raised whether Nvidia rushed the launch of the RTX 5090 and 5080.
- Reviews suggest that RTX 5080 underdelivers on the big expectations surrounding it.
- Demonstrations of RTX 5090 capabilities, showcasing 4K performance and advanced graphical features for games like Half-Life 2.
- Nvidia addresses claims regarding RTX 50 laptop GPUs missing ROPs, asserting there is no problem and testing is ongoing.
- Reports confirm early production issues with RTX 5080 and 5070 Ti, prompting replacement provisions.

items.title: Contentious Republican town halls are going viral
items.author: Mia Sato

items.title: Message threads are coming to WhatsApp
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- WhatsApp is developing a message threading feature to group replies to specific messages.
- This will create a dedicated view for quoted messages, aiding conversation tracking and navigation.
- Threading will be available in individual conversations, group chats, and channels, but is still under development.
- A preview screenshot reveals a pop-up for viewing replies in threads.
- There is no timeline yet for the general rollout of the feature for all users.

items.title: Revisiting Windows 1.0: how Microsoft’s first desktop gracefully failed
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Windows 1.0 launched on November 20, 1985, amid skepticism about its capabilities and design.
- It was Microsoft's first attempt at a graphical user interface (GUI), competing against Apple's established market.
- Initially sold for $99, it included basic applications like Notepad and Windows Paint but required significant memory and resources to operate effectively.
- Critics gave Windows 1.0 mixed reviews, with concerns regarding its speed and capability to handle multitasking on standard PCs.
- The OS sold poorly and required two more versions before it gained traction in the market, highlighting the challenges of introducing new paradigms in technology.

items.title: Spectre Divide and Its Developer Are Shutting Down
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- *Spectre Divide*, a free-to-play shooter by Mountaintop Studios, is shutting down within 30 days after its September launch.
- The game had around 400,000 players with a peak concurrent count of 10,000, but failed to maintain enough active players to cover costs.
- Refunds will be issued for all money since the game’s first season began on February 25.
- Mountaintop Studios will close its doors at the end of the week after exploring other options for survival.
- The game’s initial launch faced server issues, which hindered momentum, leading to immediate declines in player count post-launch.

items.title: The best deals on MacBooks right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
• Apple is selling MacBooks with its own M-series chips in various sizes and prices.
• The M1 MacBook Air has been discontinued, but some retailers still sell it starting at $649.
• Discounts on recent MacBook models can be as high as $400.
• The M1 MacBook Air is available at Walmart for $629, its lowest price to date.
• The M2 MacBook Air starts at $799 with 16GB RAM and 256GB storage, available at Amazon and Best Buy.
• New models, like the M3 MacBook Air, start at $849, with discounts offered through B&H Photo and Amazon.
• Apple has also updated its lineup with M4 models, starting at $949 for the 13-inch variant with enhanced features.

items.title: Meta is trying to block ex-employee’s book alleging misconduct and harassment
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- An arbitrator ruled in favor of Meta against ex-employee Sarah Wynn-Williams regarding her memoir, *Careless People: A Cautionary Tale of Power, Greed, and Lost Idealism*, published this week.
- The memoir includes alleged claims of sexual harassment involving current policy chief Joel Kaplan.
- The arbitrator's decision requires Wynn-Williams to stop making disparaging remarks about Meta and cease further promotion and publication of the book, but it’s unclear if the ruling can prevent future book sales.
- Meta spokesperson Andy Stone stated that the ruling affirms the book is false and defamatory, attributing its publication to a lack of proper fact-checking.

items.title: The Best Android Phones: A Comprehensive Guide
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The Android ecosystem offers a wider range of device choices compared to iOS.
- Significant recent Android phone recommendations based on extensive personal testing.
- Importance of features such as durable design, software updates, resolution, and camera capabilities.
- Coverage of top Android phones including Google Pixel 9 and Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra, with pricing and specifications mentioned.
- Discussion on the relevance of AI in current Android devices, with caution to temper expectations about its capabilities.
- The importance of considering carrier offers and unlocked phones for freedom in choice and flexibility.

items.title: Meta is trying to ‘offload’ kids safety onto app stores with new bills, Google says
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Meta advocates for new laws requiring app stores to control kids' app downloads, seeing early success with Utah's new legislation.
- Google criticizes this approach as a way for Meta to evade its responsibilities towards child safety, raising concerns about privacy risks from sharing user data with app developers without consent.
- The legislation mandates app stores to prevent children from accessing inappropriate content, which Google argues benefits social media platforms at the expense of user privacy.
- Google proposes that only apps providing risky content should require age verification, shifting responsibility to developers instead of app stores.
- Apple shares similar concerns regarding excessive data collection and emphasizes minimal data use for privacy protection.

items.title: UK investigation says Apple and Google are ‘holding back’ mobile browsers
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The UK’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) investigation reveals Apple and Google hinder competition in mobile browsers.
- Apple requires all iOS browsers to use its WebKit engine, limiting competition, while Google’s Android also restricts options.
- Concerns include Safari being default on iPhones and Chrome on Android, reducing user awareness of alternatives.
- Both companies made some changes to improve browser choice since the provisional findings in November.
- CMA suggests remedies including allowing alternative engines on iOS and a browser choice screen at setup, though currently unenforceable.
- Separate CMA investigations into Apple and Google’s ecosystems are ongoing, with potential to designate them as having strategic market status (SMS).

items.title: AMD’s partners are already scalping their ‘MSRP’ 9070 and 9070 XT
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- AMD’s Radeon 9070 and 9070 XT graphics cards are being scalped by retailers, with prices rising $50-$130 above their original MSRPs of $550 and $600.
- Retailers like Newegg and Overclockers UK have raised prices on certain models ahead of new shipments, with notable increases: 9070 XT Reaper at $700, 9070 XT Swift at $730, and 9070 Gaming OC at $670.
- Not all retailers have updated prices yet; Best Buy has not changed its MSRP listings, although it is out of stock.
- In contrast, Nvidia cards remain at MSRP with no significant scalping detected at major US retailers.

items.title: Amtrak's Revamped App Makes It Easier to Find Your Train Status
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Amtrak is revamping its mobile app to enhance user experience with features for tracking train status and schedule changes.
- The app now displays train status and schedule changes directly on the reservation screen, improving accessibility for users.
- Updates include the ability for business class riders to select preferred seating, a redesigned homescreen separating tickets from marketing, and a new My Trips tab for easier trip management.
- The updated app is available for download on [iOS](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/amtrak/id405074003) and [Android](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fplay.google.com%2Fstore%2Fapps%2Fdetails%3Fid%3Dcom.amtrak.rider%26hl%3Den_US%26pli%3D1).

items.title: Intel Appoints Lip-Bu Tan as New CEO
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Intel has appointed Lip-Bu Tan as the new CEO, effective March 18th.
- Lip-Bu Tan previously served as CEO at Cadence and was on Intel’s board from 2022 to 2024.
- Former CEO Pat Gelsinger was reportedly pushed out by the board after losing faith in his strategy.
- Tan aims to strengthen Intel's manufacturing and computing platform.
